definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Later, the old couple began to feel sorry for her and brought her out a small stool.
sentences.chinese: 后来，老夫妻竟有些过意不去，给她拿出一只小板凳。

sentences.english: I'm very sorry my mistake gave you so much trouble.
sentences.chinese: 由于我的失误，给你添了这么多麻烦，真过意不去。

sentences.english: I'm very much indebted for having troubled you.
sentences.chinese: 打扰了你我感到非常过意不去。

sentences.english: We feel bad about the unloved toy or the uneaten food.
sentences.chinese: 我们会对不喜欢的玩具或没吃的食物感到过意不去。

sentences.english: But again he felt the tug of his conscience.
sentences.chinese: 这使得韩再一次感觉到他的良心过意不去。

sentences.english: A:I can't tell how sorry I am for giving you such a fright.
sentences.chinese: 让您这么受惊吓我实在过意不去。

sentences.english: And I do feel bad about your mother having to take care of the baby all weekend.
sentences.chinese: 而且我觉得很过意不去让你母亲整个周末照顾孩子。

sentences.english: Marilyn: And I do feel bad about your mother having to take care of the baby all weekend.
sentences.chinese: 而且我觉得很过意不去让你母亲整个周末照顾孩子。

sentences.english: Maximizers expend more time and energy reaching decisions, and they're often anxious about their choices.
sentences.chinese: 完美型的决策费时费力且对自己的抉择总过意不去。

definition: to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
to offer an apology/to make amends
